articles.headline: Owners Lose and Bosses Win in Bad Mergers
articles.snippet: Academic research offers insights into how the very equity-based incentives that were supposed to make managers think like owners have instead encouraged them to overpay for acquisitions.
articles.abstract: Academic research offers insights into how the very equity-based incentives that were supposed to make managers think like owners have instead encouraged them to overpay for acquisitions.
articles.lead_paragraph: If it’s not your money, you may be quite willing to spend more of it.

articles.headline: Pill That Eliminates the Period Gets Mixed Reviews
articles.snippet: Some women are uneasy about the idea of a contraceptive pill that is designed to eliminate monthly menstruation.
articles.abstract: Some women are uneasy about the idea of a contraceptive pill that is designed to eliminate monthly menstruation.
articles.lead_paragraph: For many women, a birth control pill that eliminates monthly menstruation might seem a welcome milestone.

articles.headline: Profits Up 69% at Google, Exceeding Expectations
articles.snippet: The company’s core search and advertising business continued to outpace that of Microsoft and Yahoo.
articles.abstract: The company’s core search and advertising business continued to outpace that of Microsoft and Yahoo.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, April 19  For much of this year, the buzz around Google has been all about the flurry of new initiatives at the No. 1 Internet search company, from its YouTube video sharing site, to its new software for office workers, to its forays into television, radio and newspaper advertising.

articles.headline: In China, Talk of Democracy Is Simply That
articles.snippet: By permitting an open round of political discussion, China’s leaders are casting themselves as progressives.
articles.abstract: By permitting an open round of political discussion, China’s leaders are casting themselves as progressives.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING, April 14 — Like the spring showers that give the parched landscape a veneer of green, China’s authoritarian leaders, approaching the end of their five-year terms in office, have suggested that they would like to see their country become more democratic.

articles.headline: Anger of Killer Was on Exhibit in His Writings
articles.snippet: Professors and students in the English department at Virginia Tech knew of the mental turmoil of Cho Seung-Hui through his writings and images.
articles.abstract: Professors and students in the English department at Virginia Tech knew of the mental turmoil of Cho Seung-Hui through his writings and images.
articles.lead_paragraph: BLACKSBURG, Va., April 19 — More than anyone else on the Virginia Tech campus, it was the professors and students in the English department who knew of the mental turmoil of Cho Seung-Hui.
articles.byline: By Marc Santora and Christine Hauser

articles.headline: Ex-Chief at Qwest Found Guilty of Insider Trading
articles.snippet: The jury convicted Joseph P. Nacchio on 19 of 42 insider trading counts related to his sale of Qwest stock in 2001.
articles.abstract: The jury convicted Joseph P. Nacchio on 19 of 42 insider trading counts related to his sale of Qwest stock in 2001.
articles.lead_paragraph: DENVER, April 19 — Joseph P. Nacchio, the former chief executive who transformed Qwest Communications International into a major telecommunications rival, was convicted Thursday of insider trading.

articles.headline: Organic Milk Supply Expected to Surge as Farmers Pursue a Payoff
articles.snippet: Dairy farmers are rushing to convert to organic milk production before new, more stringent federal regulations take effect.
articles.abstract: Dairy farmers are rushing to convert to organic milk production before new, more stringent federal regulations take effect.
articles.lead_paragraph: Dairy farmers are rushing to convert to organic milk production, and it is largely because of a blueberry farmer who lives in Maine with a solar-powered computer and an outhouse outfitted with a stained-glass window.

articles.headline: Big Money in Little Screens
articles.snippet: Google, Microsoft and Yahoo have trained their sights on cellphones as the next great battleground in the Internet search wars.
articles.abstract: Google, Microsoft and Yahoo have trained their sights on cellphones as the next great battleground in the Internet search wars.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, April 19 — Searching the Web on a mobile phone has been a lot like getting online via dial-up modem circa 1995: slow, tedious and not terribly useful. Typing on tiny buttons, squinting at a list of links and clicking through to a page that won’t display properly is enough to test anyone’s patience.
